page.title: 04BARNSLEY'S WORKSHOPS.
page.content: Edward Barnsley's workshop was set up by his father,Ernest,his Uncle, Sidney and Ernest Gimson.At present,6 people work there.They design and manufacture furniture to special order but when business is slack they make and sell for the local market.One apprentice craftsman is currently engaged on a two month project making a chest of drawers with matching drawer fronts in yew.The Domesday Book is being rebound locally & Edward's workshop is making the Oak covers for it. Edward's work is world famous,and he has supplied furniture as far afield as Australia. Lupton,Edward's mentor,built Edward's house and Edward and Gimson built the magnificent and unique oak library at Bedales School. Edward's career peaked between the 50's and 70's.His designs, dating back to the 20's, are now being sorted and catalogued at the workshop.
